title: digaran
author: digaran
created_time: November 25, 2023, 07:47:30 AMLast edit: January 20, 2024, 07:05:41 AM by digaran

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: If a staff member locks your thread, you can't unlock it from your end. They have to be the ones to do it. If a mod moves your thread to another location, you can move it back or move it somewhere else entirely. But that's about it. If you feel that a thread should be locked, then you can report it and explain why you think that is. Point out what rules it breaks. Btw, where is that link he posted to avoid detection? I don't see it in his thread. Did it get deleted?

comments.author: lucifur
comments.body: Quote from: digaran on November 25, 2023, 07:47:30 AMI can't control myself seeing bitcoin sv account talking, it's like he is raping my girl in front of me, and laughing to my face. üò§üò§üò§I've seen a lot of false claims here. You can just ignore the user if you don't want to see them post.

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: If moderator lock a topic, OP of the topic can not unclok the topic unless moderator unlock it again.Quote from: digaran on November 25, 2023, 07:47:30 AMIs it reasonable to ask a mod to lock the thread until OP could provide evidence? Where is the red line of misinformation and deliberate spreading of lies to damage Bitcoin?Even without any evidence, no moderator will lock the thread because of that reason. There are many lying posts that I have seen on this forum and non were locked becuase moderators also do not know if it is true or not. Also from the thread, some people will learn from the thread as some people will explain why using cold wallet to store your coins is safer instead of hot using wallets.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Quote from: digaran on November 25, 2023, 08:03:32 AMI reported it, yes. I was wondering if there is a policy regarding these issues. If it was a phishing link, malware, or something nasty, then I would be in favor of banning the person doing it. Other than that, I don't think the forum and its administration will (or should) take the route of censoring information they don't like. If someone wants to discuss how bad Bitcoin or a piece of software is, let them do it. Point out why they are wrong and what knowledge they are missing or ignore them for your own health. We have that maniac (fxsurfer, antikvark, whatever the name is) who returns every couple of months and creates a few threads bashing bitcoin, everyone argues with him, and then he disappears, only to come back again some day.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: If it was possible for users to unlock threads after mods lock them, it will make the whole process redundant. Mods typically lock threads that have become spam dumps and if the op was able to unlock the thread, they will just open up the spamming again.Quote from: digaran on November 25, 2023, 07:47:30 AMI can't control myself seeing bitcoin sv account talking, it's like he is raping my girl in front of me, and laughing to my face. üò§üò§üò§But in reality he is seeking attention by consistently sending unsolicited photoshopped pictures of him and your girl. Trolls like that got nothing on Bitcoin, they just want the attention of talking about it.Quote from: digaran on November 25, 2023, 08:03:32 AMDid you read what I said? Could you ignore such an act? LolYou could and should.If you don't want to, just point out the flaws in the argument and move on.

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: Quote from: digaran on November 25, 2023, 07:47:30 AMShould we let them be since they have claimed that they were hacked, do we have the right to ask a mod to lock it and ask the OP to provide evidence and then they could unlock it themselves?I don't think he can truly prove the hacking itself.¬† Even with that signed addresses, it doesn't actually confirm a hack took place and¬† seems to me he might've just moved those coins into another wallet that he controls. There was no hacking, just a normal transaction. Quote from: digaran on November 25, 2023, 07:47:30 AMI can't control myself seeing bitcoin sv account talking, <cut>I understand what you mean. Unfortunately, there's not much we can do with a troll account, except report their posts as off-topic or spam, or just ignore them altogether.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: You cannot unlock that topic and you will find a warning ‚ÄúThis topic has been locked by mod‚Äù but you can return the topic to another board. If you continue moving topics to inappropriate boards, you may be banned, and as I remember, it happened once.I think this topic has turned into spam, so you can report it.

comments.author: Helena Yu
comments.body: The @OP create the thread, giving 4 TX IDs come from his wallet, and why you must force him to sign a message? after all it's his coins except the @OP gave a promise to share 10% of his coins for someone that can help him.Just stop to reply when you're not interested with the discussions.Quote from: digaran on November 25, 2023, 07:47:30 AMI can't control myself seeing bitcoin sv account talking, it's like he is raping my girl in front of me, and laughing to my face. üò§üò§üò§That's called freedom of speech, just like you harassing users who left negative feedbacks into your account.

Trolls like that got nothing on Bitcoin, they just want the attention of talking about it.BSV is to blame everywhere you goSomeone didn't sign the Bitcoin message - it's BSV,s faultsomeone made a mistake somewhere- it's BSV,s faultetcI'm just there to say that irreversible BTC transactions is sucks. People's balances are stolen from their wallets, and then people suffer. And the hackers are happy and unpunished.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Quote from: hugeblack on November 25, 2023, 08:56:02 AM...but you can return the topic to another board. If you continue moving topics to inappropriate boards, you may be banned, and as I remember, it happened once. I forgot the name of the user, but it was a temporary ban, wasn't it? The user returned to the forum later after the ban but stopped posting altogether after a while. I remember the drama. He felt the thread should be where he posted it but the mod didn't agree and thought the content isn't fitting for that board. The topic was then edited a bit only to be moved back and forth again. He was warned not to do it, did it again, and got banned...

comments.author: Bitcoin SV
comments.body: Quote from: Helena Yu on November 25, 2023, 09:11:10 AMThat's called freedom of speechThanks for clarifying. Now I understand why the troll nutildah insults me and nothing happens to him for it

comments.author: OcTradism
comments.body: Quote from: digaran on November 25, 2023, 07:47:30 AMShould we let them be since they have claimed that they were hacked, do we have the right to ask a mod to lock it and ask the OP to provide evidence and then they could unlock it themselves?If a moderator locked your topic, you can unlock it.If an admin locked your topic, you can not unlock it. I only don't know a global moderator has same power like forum admins in locking a topic.If it is because of an account hack, the account can be frozen because of security issue, not only a topic. The user has to prove the actual ownership to get access to the account and access to his topics.

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: Helena Yu on November 25, 2023, 09:11:10 AMJust stop to reply when you're not interested with the discussions.Not saying its the case here, but Bitcoin Discussion board is such a cespool because people are making all kinds of bullshit topics there and what's even worse, people answer to them instead reporting. So no, ignoring is not always the best course of action. Quote from: Pmalek on November 25, 2023, 09:19:34 AMI forgot the name of the user, but it was a temporary ban, wasn't it? The user returned to the forum later after the ban but stopped posting altogether after a while. I remember the drama. He felt the thread should be where he posted it but the mod didn't agree and thought the content isn't fitting for that board. The topic was then edited a bit only to be moved back and forth again. He was warned not to do it, did it again, and got banned... ¬†Iirc it was nutildah that you are talking about. Unless there were more similar cases.

comments.author: Bitcoin SV
comments.created_time: November 25, 2023, 09:40:32 AMLast edit: November 25, 2023, 09:52:18 AM by Bitcoin SV
comments.body: Quote from: OcTradism on November 25, 2023, 09:33:31 AMIf a moderator locked your topic, you can unlock it.If an admin locked your topic, you can not unlock it. I only don't know a global moderator has same power like forum admins in locking a topic.Do not mislead peopleIf a moderator or global mod has blocked a topic, then the author of the topic will not be able to unblock itAn admin can also block a topic, but in practice no one will even remember the last time he did thisQuote from: Rikafip on November 25, 2023, 09:35:15 AMit was nutildah that you are talking about. Unless there were more similar cases. Do you see? I think that nutildah should be excluded from DT for such behavior. I thought nutildah was just a troll, but now I see that nutildah is also an system abuser
